action.action-desc: Mr. O'Halleran introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to fill vacancies and increase the number of positions available in the Forest Service Law Enforcement and Investigations organization, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Forest Service Law Enforcement Enhancement Act of 2022.

section.header: Filling vacancies and increasing number of positions available in the Forest Service Law Enforcement and Investigations organization

subsection.text: The Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, shall—

paragraph.text: fill all vacancies in the Forest Service Law Enforcement and Investigations organization; and
upon filling such vacancies, increase the number of positions available in the Forest Service Law Enforcement and Investigations organization.

subsection.text: In seeking to fill vacancies and increase the number of positions under subsection (a), the Secretary shall prioritize filling vacancies and increasing the number of positions in the Forest Service that—

paragraph.text: are at high or very high risk of wildfires; and
are areas of substantial public use.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 and 2024.
Not more than 3 percent of the amount made available for a fiscal year under paragraph (1) may be used by the Secretary for the administrative costs of carrying out this section.
